com.here.msdkui.routing

Class SimpleTransportModePanelAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.view.PagerAdapter
      • android.support.v4.app.FragmentStatePagerAdapter
        • com.here.msdkui.routing.TransportModePanelAdapter
          • com.here.msdkui.routing.SimpleTransportModePanelAdapter

  • public class SimpleTransportModePanelAdapter
extends TransportModePanelAdapter
    A pre-defined adapter class for TransportModePanel to show a TabLayout structure displaying all possible transport modes with icons.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class android.support.v4.view.PagerAdapter

        POSITION_NONE, POSITION_UNCHANGED

      Constructs a new instance using the given list of RouteOptions.TransportMode elements.

    • Method Detail

      • getContent

        public android.support.v4.app.Fragment getContent(com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode mode)
        Description copied from class: TransportModePanelAdapter
        Gets the fragment of TransportModePanel.

        If you don't want to display content and only want to have a TabView in TransportModePanel, please return null and return false from TransportModePanelAdapter.isContentVisible() method.

        Specified by:
        getContent in class TransportModePanelAdapter
        Parameters:
        mode - the RouteOptions.TransportMode.
        Returns:
        the fragment of the panel hosting the content.

      • getTabCustomView

        @Deprecated
public TabView getTabCustomView(com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode mode)
        Deprecated. Please use getCustomTabView(com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode) instead.
        Gets a custom TabView with drawable icons which can be used to add labels by calling TabView.setLabel(String) in the respective switch statements.
        Specified by:
        getTabCustomView in class TransportModePanelAdapter
        Parameters:
        mode - the RouteOptions.TransportMode.
        Returns:
        the TabView that is used to represent the given transport mode.

      • getCustomTabView

        public TabView getCustomTabView(com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode mode)
        Gets a custom TabView with drawable icons which can be used to add labels by calling TabView.setLabel(String) in the respective switch statements.
        Specified by:
        getCustomTabView in class TransportModePanelAdapter
        Parameters:
        mode - the RouteOptions.TransportMode.
        Returns:
        the TabView that is used to represent the given transport mode.

      • isContentVisible

        public boolean isContentVisible()
        Description copied from class: TransportModePanelAdapter
        Indicates whether the content is visible. This is responsible for showing the fragment hosting the content for a RouteOptions.TransportMode in the TransportModePanel. If the method returns false, the method TransportModePanelAdapter.getItem(int) will be ignored.
        Specified by:
        isContentVisible in class TransportModePanelAdapter
        Returns:
        true if content should be visible, false will hide the content.
